bibl.title: Albert Rhude v. A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound. Request for Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound

div1.ab: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle.
In the Matter of the application of Albert Rhude for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Roger S. Greene, Judge of the above entitled court:,
The petition of Albert Rhude respectfully shows:
div1.p: That he the said Albert Rhude is unlawfully imprisioned, detained, confined, and restrained of his liberty, by J.H. McGraw, Sheriff of King County, Washington Territory at the City of Seattle in said King County. That the cause or pretense of the restraint according to best of the knowledge and belief of this applicant is what pretends to be a warrant of arrest issued in caused that petitioner is defendant.
That the said imprisonment, detention, confinement, and restraint are illegal; and that the illegality thereof consists in this towit:

That the said cause No. 4184 on the docket fo said district court, wherein the A.P. Hotaling Company of Puget Sound is Plaintiff, and your petitioner is defendant is not a cuase wherein the defendant can be arrested or held to bail.

That no warrant of arrest as required by law was ever issued in said cause; that no affidavits required by law were ever filed in said cause; that the order in said cause for a warrant for the arrest of this petitioner specified as the amount in which the defendant should be held to bail the sum of one thousand dollars, which said sum was more than double the demand of the plaintiff in said cause, and one hundred dollars in addition thereto; that the court did not in said order fix the amount of the bond to be given by the plaintiff in said
any bind whatever of the plaintiff in said cause; that no bond as required in sectionCXIX of the Code of Washington, or any bond whatever was filed by the plaintiff in the office of the clerk of said court before the issuance of the warrant of arrest of your petitioner in said cause; that the proof on which the said order was made is insufficent for the granting of such an order an the facts alleged in such proofs are untrue; that no copy of the complaint or summons in said cause have ever been served upon this defendant or had this defendant ever been served with any process or papers in said cause;; That no copy of the warrant of arrest in said cause had ever been delievered to him by the sheriff as required by law; that the paper purporting to be a warrant in said cause and under which your petitioner is now illegally restrained and imprisoned as aforesaid, did not contain a short statement of or any statement whatever of the alleged causes for which the order was granted, as required by law. That the complaint of the plaintiff in said cuase did not state facts sufficient to constitue a cause of action against this petitioner.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus Shoul be granted directed to the said J.H. McGraw Sheriff as aforesaid, commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and recieve what shall be considered by your Honor concerning him, together with the time and cause of his detention, and said writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty and that in the meantime he be admitted to bail in such as to the court may seem just.
div1.ab: Dated on the 8th day of November A.D. 1884
Territory of Washington, County of King | ss.
div1.p: Albert Rhude being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is the Petitioner petition in the above entitled action; that he has heard the foregoing petition read, knows the contents thereof, and believes the same to be true; that he makes this affidavit because
div1.ab: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10th day of November 1884 Maurice Mcmicken Notary Public in and for King County, Washington Territory.
No 4185 In the District Court, Third Judicial District, holding terms at Seattle
Application for Habeas Corpus of Albert Rhodes Defendant
Petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed .......... 188 Filed Nov 10 1884 By James Seavey, Clerk By James P Ludlow Deputy.
Struve, Haines amperstand McMicken Attorneys for Pet
